text:
Hi everyone!! What’s up? I'm Andrea, 
your RealLife English fluency coach.

Welcome to Learn English with TV series. 
As you may have noticed, we love TV series!

And today we'll present you 10 original and 
well-known series that are available on Disney+

every English learner should watch to hone their 
English skills! Because we help you use series,

movies, songs and much more to learn 
English in a fun and entertaining way.

Just like Sasi who says she's become addicted 
to studying for the first time. Have you ever also

thought of watching scenes from your favorite 
series without getting lost, without missing

the jokes and without subtitles? Make sure you 
hit that subscribe button so you don't miss out.

I shall destroy your happiness 
if it is the last thing I do.

Nothing says Disney more than fairytales, but
for the Once Upon a Time series characters,

their happy ending may not come so soon.
In this fanciful series, all the characters

we know and love are trapped in a place
where all the happy endings were stolen:

Our real world. During 7 seasons, you can follow
the story of Snow White, Prince Charming,

Ariel, Cinderella, and many other characters
who were cursed into forgetting all about

their past magical lives in the fantasy world.
The best part is: You can take your listening

skills to a whole new level as the series
features actors with the most varied accents!

Wanda, can you hear me?
Who is doing this to you?

I tried to choose just one, but I couldn't! If you are
into superhero movies, then you must watch

Wandavision and Loki, that's for sure! For the
first one, we have a whole lesson dedicated to it that

you can watch next. Now, Loki blew me away
with how they play with the good vs evil boundaries.

It tells the stories ​​of the mischievous villain
escaping the clutches of The Avengers after

the events of Avengers: Endgame. And if you
are a Marvel fan or just enjoy adventurous storylines,

you can also find other Marvel series there,
such as The Falcon and the Winter Soldier,

Hawkeye, Ms. Marvel, She-Hulk,
and of course, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D!

That's the thing about Loki is he just... What I say about 
Loki is like, "I'm Loki and when I die, I don't."

Madam President, what is in there? - It's 
my old diary. I started writing in the

sixth grade. It's a day by day account of 
how I got here. I really had a lot to say.

This one tells the story of a Cuban-American girl
making her way through middle school while

preparing herself to pursue a big aspiration:
to become the president of the United States.

You can learn conversational phrases and
everyday vocabulary Silent because the series has

a lot of voice-overs of Elena
reading from her own diary.

Hello world, or should
I say, dear diary.

My name is Elena Ofelia Cañero-Reed. I'm 12 years 
old and I live with my brother and my mother.

That's Sasha, my loyal friend. And Joey Feldstein. 
- Your love hasn't been faded since like Kindergarten.
What's up?
You are the music in me.

High School Musical movies
marked a whole generation.

So much so that the movie inspired a series
of its own. This mockumentary musical drama follows

the members of a drama club in the preparation
for a production inspired by the original movies.

We believe that songs are a powerful way
to practice pronunciation, memorization of

grammar structures, and are also a nice way
to learn new words. Just like the original movies,

this one is full of catchy songs that will get you
practicing your English without even realizing it!

- Excuse me, is there somewhere you're supposed to be?
- Broadway.

- I sort of gave up when we got to High School.
- Yeah, I think that's when I started having a thing for you.

Before there were streaming platforms, and
even before Disney concentrated all of its

productions on Disney+, the Disney Channel
was the place to go for some laid-back teenage-themed

fun. From Phineas and Ferb to Hannah Montana
and Wizards of Waverly Place, you can watch all the old

original series. What's nice about teenage series
is that they show situations we can all relate to.
You learn while having fun!

If you like talking about TV series,
movies, culture and so much more,

make sure to download the RealLife App.
This is your chance to practice your speaking

FOR FREE! Just go to the Google Play
Store or Apple App Store and download it now.

At the touch of a button, you will connect
with people from all over the world for short

4-minute conversations! And what’s more,
you can also listen to all of our upcoming and past

podcasts while following the transcription and
learning the most important words from the show!

You can click up here as well and I'll 
leave a link down in the description.
Now let's continue with our list.

Glee clubs, that is, groups
of multiple voices that usually sing

sections of songs, are a big part of American
culture. So is this show. You'll be able to follow

the journey and life of American adolescents
while enjoying original versions of the best hit songs.

Why not give it a try and take the chance to sing
along with them? There are also many celebrity

guest stars, such as Lindsay Lohan, Ricky
Martin, and even Britney Spears. If you’re a fan of Britney

Spears, like me, you can check out
this lesson we made with her next!
I'm so close. I'm so close.
Here we go. Here we go.
Oh my God!

Have you ever wondered what celebrities
would be like if they had

to survive in the wild? Well, in this reality show,
the famous adventurer Bear Grylls

brings prominent stars who push
themselves as much as they can

during 48 hours of inhospitable
conditions in the wild.
Well, what do you know?

Disney isn't Disney without Mickey Mouse!
You can have lots of fun with the cartoon series!

Not only that!  You can also find other classic
Disney animations that were turned into series,

such as Monsters At Work and Lilo & Stitch.
Also, if you are a Disney fan, you won't want to miss

the docuseries The Imagineering Story about
Walt Disney Universe. If you haven’t heard of

docuseries, they are television shows that follow
a particular person while they engage in real

events. It's perfect for noticing the
authentic use of the language!

Anytime you take people behind the scenes you
see the imperfections, the trial and error for the experimentation.

Behind all of these curtains are different 
projects going on. This is the cutting edge
of the technology of imagineering.
Homer Simpson here. Proud addition to the Disney

family and soon appearing on Disney+. I 
for one salute our new corporate overlords.

The Simpsons have referenced pretty much
every trendy pop culture icon, and although

they may not be that accurate all the time, 
they are certainly up for a good laugh.

The show has been running for more than
30 years so if you are up for a good immersion
in the language, this is the show for you.

Put on the ears, boy!
Marge?
What the... This is a great honor.

The songs of eons past tell of 
battles between Mandalore the Great
and an order of sorcerers called Jedi.

You expect me to search the galaxy and deliver 
this creature to a race of enemy sorcerers?
This is the way.

One of the biggest hypes around
Disney+ was certainly seeing Baby Yoda in The

Mandalorian series. On this show, you'll follow
the story after the fall of the Empire. The good thing

about classics like Star Wars is that they are
good conversation starters whether you have seen

them or not. And, speaking of the Star Wars
Universe, you should also check the anime version of it
the Star Wars: Vision series of short films.

- This is the one that you hunted and saved?
- Yes.

- The one that saved me as well.
- Come on baby! Do the magic hand thing!
Stop touching things.

I hope you enjoyed today's diverse list. Let’s
share in the comments below what our all-time

favorite Disney+ series is and what new
vocabulary you have already learned with it!

I can't stress enough how series are a way of
making English fun! The stories, the characters,

the scenery all inspire us.  And, just like
Lindsay says it here, if you fall in love
with the language, learning it will be much easier.
